issue.title: www.pizzahut.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.pizzahut.com/index.php?f=login#/sign-in/home](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pizzahut.com%2Findex.php%3Ff%3Dlogin%23%2Fsign-in%2Fhome) ### Comment Username: @goodjohnjr > When trying to log in to Pizza Hut, nothing would happen when I click the sign-in button, until I disabled AdGuard For Windows. > > I had this problem before with the AdGuard web browser extension, I am not sure which list is the problem and / or if it is AdGuard DNS issue. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/r9O7YYG.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/d2aFrS9.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.12 Browser: | Edge AdGuard driver: | WFP Stealth mode: | disabled DNS filtering: | server: `AdGuard DNS Default Public Server`
filters: `AdGuard DNS` Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Annoyances:

Online Malicious URL Blocklist,
NoCoin Filter List

AdBlockID,
Official Polish filters for AdBlock, uBlock Origin & AdGuard,
Polish Anti Adblock Filters Userscripts: | All of them

comment.body:
I just did a test without any AdGuard products / services being installed or used.

Microsoft Edge with Norton Safe Web, Malwarebytes Browser Guard, LanguageTool, Video DownloadHelper, and uBlock Origin (all default lists, Ublock Annoyances, all security lists enabled), CleanBrowsing DNS Adult Filter, and I was able to log in without any problems.
